page.title: 09FIELD STUDIES - HORTON KIRBY
page.content: The 2 old schools in Horton Kirby are now used as field centres. The {Darent Valley}is of great interest for field studies and environmental studies. It contains historic sites such as{Lullingstone Roman Villa, several interesting villages and a variety of natural habitats. The Horton Road Environmental Studies Centre, run by the Inner London Education Authority, is used by 26 selected primary schools from Educational Priority Areas. There are 2 full-time and 2 part-time staff. The Centre has 3 classrooms and a library. Each class makes a series of visits throughout the year carrying out a programme of varied activities. The children are mainly 9 to 11 years old. Coach trips are made to local places of interest. There are 3 groups working at the Centre every day.
